pageTitle: Comparing Salesforce Edge and Salesforce Express Connect (SEC)

header.text: A comparison between Salesforce Edge and Salesforce Express Connect (SEC)

items.name: Salesforce Edge
items.description: Salesforce Edge provides faster access to Salesforce by reducing network latency, enhancing performance for users distributed across multiple regions.
pros: Improved application performance. Customers get benefits such as faster download times no matter where their org is hosted in Salesforceâ€™s data centers.
Directs customer requests to the closest Salesforce location where Salesforce Edge Network is deployed. At that location, Salesforce Edge Network provides a range of services, including:

nestedPros: TLS Termination - Brings TLS termination closer to the users.
Static Content Caching - The static content is cached closer to the user.
Route Optimization - Edge will find the fastest route for you at that moment in time.
Network TCP Optimization - Helps data move more quickly and efficiently across the network.

cons: Public Internet will be used between the user and the Edge Network.

items.name: Salesforce Express Connect
items.description: Salesforce Express Connect provides a direct, private connection between Salesforce data centers and your organization's network, bypassing the public internet for more secure and reliable communication.
pros: Increased security with private network connections.
Lower latency due to direct connections.
Bypasses public internet, reducing risks of internet congestion.
Helps to meet industry regulatory and compliance demands.
cons: Requires setup and configuration of private lines.
Higher costs for dedicated network infrastructure.
Does not provide direct network connectivity to Hyperforce or non-Hyperforce Public Cloud environments.
